value.name: fps
value.description:
The FPS at which the object detector runs.
Higher values will result in more scanning, which uses more resources.

value.name: scan_on_motion_only
value.description: When set to true and a motion_detector is configured, the object detector will only scan while motion is detected.

values.name: label
values.description: The label to track.

values.name: confidence
values.description: Lowest confidence allowed for detected objects. The lower the value, the more sensitive the detector will be, and the risk of false positives will increase.

values.name: height_min
values.description: Minimum height allowed for detected objects, relative to stream height.

values.name: height_max
values.description: Maximum height allowed for detected objects, relative to stream height.

values.name: width_min
values.description: Minimum width allowed for detected objects, relative to stream width.

values.name: width_max
values.description: Maximum width allowed for detected objects, relative to stream width.
If set to true, objects matching this filter will start the recorder.

values.name: trigger_event_recording
values.description: If set to true, objects matching this filter will trigger an event recording.

values.name: store
values.description: If set to true, objects matching this filter will be stored in the database, as well as having a snapshot saved. Labels with trigger_event_recording set to true will always be stored when a recording starts, regardless of this setting.

values.name: store_interval
values.description: The interval at which the label should be stored in the database, in seconds. If set to 0, the label will be stored every time it is detected.

values.name: require_motion
values.description: If set to true, the recorder will stop as soon as motion is no longer detected, even if the object still is. This is useful to avoid never ending recordings of stationary objects, such as a car on a driveway

value.name: labels
value.description: A list of labels (objects) to track.

value.name: max_frame_age
value.description: Drop frames that are older than the given number. Specified in seconds.

value.name: log_all_objects
value.description: When set to true and loglevel is DEBUG, all found objects will be logged, including the ones not tracked by labels.

values.name: x
values.description: X-coordinate (horizontal axis).

values.name: y
values.description: Y-coordinate (vertical axis).

values.name: coordinates
values.description: List of X and Y coordinates to form a polygon

value.name: mask
value.description: A mask is used to exclude certain areas in the image from object detection.

values.name: name
values.description: Name of the zone. Has to be unique per camera.

values.name: x
values.description: X-coordinate (horizontal axis).

values.name: y
values.description: Y-coordinate (vertical axis).

values.name: coordinates
values.description: List of X and Y coordinates to form a polygon

values.name: label
values.description: The label to track.

values.name: confidence
values.description: Lowest confidence allowed for detected objects. The lower the value, the more sensitive the detector will be, and the risk of false positives will increase.

values.name: height_min
values.description: Minimum height allowed for detected objects, relative to stream height.

values.name: height_max
values.description: Maximum height allowed for detected objects, relative to stream height.

values.name: width_min
values.description: Minimum width allowed for detected objects, relative to stream width.

values.name: width_max
values.description: Maximum width allowed for detected objects, relative to stream width.
If set to true, objects matching this filter will start the recorder.

values.name: trigger_event_recording
values.description: If set to true, objects matching this filter will trigger an event recording.

values.name: store
values.description: If set to true, objects matching this filter will be stored in the database, as well as having a snapshot saved. Labels with trigger_event_recording set to true will always be stored when a recording starts, regardless of this setting.

values.name: store_interval
values.description: The interval at which the label should be stored in the database, in seconds. If set to 0, the label will be stored every time it is detected.

values.name: require_motion
values.description: If set to true, the recorder will stop as soon as motion is no longer detected, even if the object still is. This is useful to avoid never ending recordings of stationary objects, such as a car on a driveway

values.name: labels
values.description: A list of labels (objects) to track.

value.name: zones
value.description: Zones are used to define areas in the cameras field of view where you want to look for certain objects (labels).
Camera identifier. Valid characters are lowercase a-z, numbers and underscores.

value.name: cameras
value.description: Camera-specific configuration. All subordinate keys corresponds to the camera_identifier of a configured camera.

value.name: model_path
value.description:
Path or URL to a Hailo-8 model in HEF format. If a URL is provided, the model will be downloaded on startup. If not provided, a default model from Hailo's model zoo will be used.
Downloaded models are cached and won't be re-downloaded.

value.name: label_path
value.description: Path to file containing trained labels. If not provided, the COCO labels file from the darknet component will be used.

value.name: max_detections
value.description: Maximum number of detections to return.

value.name: multi_process_service
value.description: Allow multiple processes to share the Hailo device.
